content: If you’ve never been to this place, I highly recommend going there early in the morning because there’s so much to see and do. Your day is filled with shows (repeated twice) located at different spots in the park. This gives you time to explore the village area, have lunch (it’s not more expensive than in the city), and enjoy the amusement park section. 👍Be aware that it does involve quite a bit of back and forth, covering several kilometers throughout the day.The day concludes with a spectacular show ❤️ at 8:20 p.m., which is intense and incredibly beautiful. Arrive by 7:45 p.m. to secure a seat, as it’s first come, first served. 😢Business Hours:10am-7pmAddress:90 Minsokchon-ro, Giheung-gu, Yongin-si, Gyeonggi-do, South Korea

korean folk village is a popular cultural attraction in yongin, a little further away from seoul.  it is worth visiting as we could embrace back in time and experience traditional korean culture there are various aspects of korean life, like the traditional houses, performances, activities and many more.

The Korean Folk Village (한국민속촌), located in Yongin, just south of Seoul, is a large cultural and historical park that offers visitors a glimpse into traditional Korean life during the Joseon Dynasty (1392–1897). It is a popular tourist destination for those interested in Korean culture, history, and folklore, offering an immersive experience of the country’s past.

the folk village was large and many areas to explore. there were also cafes that were situated in old architecture. while there were some experiential components that were available with park entry, most of them require additional fees. the museum was good! also expected more displays of historical scene reenactment throughout the park.

A lively journey through Korea’s past with stunning traditions, hanbok-clad babies, and yummy traditional food! 🌸🏛️🍲⏳10 AM - 10 PM 📍Yongin, Gyeongi do 🇰🇷 💰somewhere between 15,000 to 30,000 KRWStep into Korea’s heritage at the Korean Folk village 🇰🇷💕you can rent a hanbok near the entrance and you see many cute babies and young couples dressed in hanbok 🎎🌟🍲💕you just feel like you took some Time Machine. 💕 animal and antique lovers can also enjoy this place iig

Korean Folklore Village is located in Longren City, several roads in Beijing. It can be reached by bus No. 37 from Shuiyuan. It usually takes more than 10 minutes. It is very convenient. There are houses and buildings in all parts of Korea in different periods. You can see thatched houses, tiled houses, stone houses, Yamen prison and various tools and farm implements at that time. In some places, traditional craftsmen made on site can watch Korean biography. Unified Wedding, Antique Photography Scene of Korean Drama

Had the privilege to cost the Korean Folks Village and witness how the Joseon live during their dynasty. They are simply amazing and amusing. Truly blessed to understand how they live and the older days. The Korean Folk Village located on a large 245 acres of land with backdrop of mountains and a river running through it. Korean Folk Village introduces traditional culture from the late Joseon period to both local and international visitors through cultural classes experience, shaman faith, seasonal customs and others.The Korean Folk Village has been a popular film site for many well-known historical dramas including My Love from the Star (2013), Moon Embracing the Sun (2012), Dong Yi (2010), Sungkyunkwan Scandal (2010), The Great Queen Seondeok (2009) and of course, the hugely popular Dae Jang Geum (2003).

Korean folk villages are really worth visiting. They have Korean traditional life customs, Korean traditional weddings, traditional performances, children's playgrounds, all kinds of Korean traditional snacks and places worth visiting.

You must remember Runningman's 185th comeback from the Star Runner. The runners crossed back 400 years ago to complete the task. Liu Dashen said the old saying, and the plot of looking for jade hairpins in the village made people laugh. With your broadcast, Korean folk villages are also popular. Actually, not only you from the stars, but also Korean dramas filmed in Korean folk villages, such as Da Chang-jin, Ren-yi, Cheng Jun-guan Gossip, Shu Da-gen-shen, Wang Man, Moon Embracing the Sun, A Lang's Mission, Tian Yu-zhi, Ma Yi, Da Feng-shui, Tian Min, Zhang Yu-zhen's Living for Love, etc.
Traveling to Korea is a must for folk villages!

The Korean government has established Korean folk villages to preserve traditional culture, aiming at educating citizens, preserving traditions, attracting tourists, increasing financial revenue for local governments and so on. In addition to the original purpose, there are also places to shoot TV dramas and antique movies. If the ratings of movies or TV plays are high, the place will become a tourist attraction. So the local government of Korea specially provides the place for making TV plays.

My first impression is, is this to the suburbs of Seoul?! I forgot to take pictures, but the surrounding facilities are quite complete. When we buy tickets and enter the park, our first feeling is Korean Times Drama.

Korean folklore village is a place of interest that Korean people and foreigners often visit, which reproduces the life in the later period of North Korea. Coming here is really like going back to the past through the tunnel of time and space. Because the folk village vividly reproduces the original life of people in the Korean period, it has also become a popular place for shooting TV dramas, films and TV works.

The Korean folklore village in Longren City, capital of Beijing, is large in scale and rich in content. It gathers more than 260 traditional houses and more than 30,000 folklore materials from the Korean Dynasty (1392-1910, also known as the Lee Dynasty for short, the last unified dynasty in the history of the Korean Peninsula). After watching the circle, it feels like taking the space-time train back to the Li Dynasty. However, what attracts me more is the wonderful performances in the open-air square. What we saw that day is the drum music of the villagers (also known as farm music). The performers'passionate revolving and jumping will surely make every visitor excited. Korean folklore villages may not be surprising to tourists from China who have a long history, but for those Korean children who come here for autumn excursions, they are enough to let them know part of the history of their country and nation. Korean Folklore Village consists of three parts, namely, the folk landscape area for restoring and displaying folklore materials and national cultural heritage, the museum area for displaying cultural heritage and folklore materials, and the market street for displaying traditional food, crafts and souvenirs.
It's one of the best places to go to Yongin ㅎㅎ

The purpose of Korean folk village is to show the life of the late Li Dynasty. There are farmhouse, house, official house, academy, Chinese medicine store, bookstore, blacksmith shop, Market Street and 99 classes of families in the late Li Dynasty. Folklore villages are large in scale and have many things. If you turn around them, you will feel as if you have returned to the Li Dynasty. Sometimes there are springboards, gyroscopes, swings and other folk activities. Very beautiful and charming scenic spots, very suitable to go.

This is the only traditional cultural theme park in Korea, and it is an unprecedented Korean folk village. Here you can experience the life and wisdom of the ancient Koreans. It is the only theme park in Korea that reproduces the life scenes of the Korean period. Tickets can be booked here:

Located near Shuiyuan, capital of Gyeonggi Dao, Korean Folklore Village covers 163 acres. It gathers farm houses, monasteries, noble residences and government buildings in all parts of Korea to reproduce the cultural landscape and regional customs of the Lee Dynasty more than 500 years ago on the Korean Peninsula. There are 240 traditional buildings in the village, including "Yamen" in the Li Dynasty, prisons, residences of high officials and nobles, simple houses of the people, shops, workshops, children's paradise and so on.

The scenic spot is super beautiful, and it's very close to Seoul, and the tickets are not expensive. You can see Korean historical national costumes and listen to the guide saying that this is the place where the aristocrats lived in the Korean era. It feels like watching Korean TV costume dramas. Haha, it's fun and worth going. There are also delicious mung bean pancakes.

Korean Folklore Village gathers farmhouse, monastery, noble residence and government buildings all over Korea to reproduce the cultural landscape and regional customs of the Li Dynasty more than 500 years ago on the Korean Peninsula. There are 240 traditional buildings in the village, including "Yamen" in the Li Dynasty, prisons, residences of high officials and nobles, simple houses of the people, shops, workshops, children's paradise and so on. (1) Most of the goods in shops and open-air fairs in folk villages are local traditional handicraft products and food with unique flavor, such as wood carvings, painted paper fans, ethnic clothing, colored porcelain, etc. Porcelain is a special product here, there are more than 60 kinds, all of which have high preservation value. There are many kinds of food in the folk village. The most popular food for tourists is cookies and rice wine. Every day in the open air, there are wonderful performances, such as - "folk dance, acrobatics and folk drums, which are very lively. The villagers here wore the clothes of the ancient Li Dynasty, deduced the customs of the ancient villagers, married the bride, sent the deceased into the earth and other rituals are truly imitating the Li Dynasty.

Fortunately, I went to this scenic spot. I really think it's a good place to relax on weekends. In the afternoon, there are performances: 14:00 Agricultural Music Show, 14:30 Rope Walking, 15:00 Horse Riding Martial Arts, 16:00 Traditional Wedding. We went to see traditional weddings, from welcoming relatives to worship halls, all kinds of role-playing, dialogue, no big details, or very feel, can experience the traditional culture. There are streams in the folk village. The water is very clear. I slipped off my shoes and went to play with the water. There is also a folk museum in the folk village, which details the growth process of ancient Korean boys and girls, Korean festivals, traditional food such as pickles and so on. To have a deep understanding of this nation.
Visiting here will give you a better understanding of the history and culture of Koreans, their stages of life, the way they celebrate different holidays, and the food they eat at certain times.

The Dalin Museum of Contemporary Art was founded in 1996 and moved from Daejeon, Korea, to Zhonglu District, Seoul, in 2002, to study and present contemporary art with photography as the core. The Museum in Bell Road was designed by Vincent Cornu, a French architect. At the beginning of the design, the need to display photographs was taken into account in humidity, lighting and temperature. The construction of the museum was undertaken by Dalin Group itself.

The traffic of Dalin Museum is convenient, the location is easy to find, the facilities are perfect and the service is good. It is very intimate to have a commentator to explain for tourists. It is very meaningful to understand the cultural background of the way.
